com.xing.api.resources

Class UserProfilesResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xing.api.Resource
      • com.xing.api.resources.UserProfilesResource

  • public class UserProfilesResource
extends Resource
    Represent the 'User Profiles' resource.

    Provides methods which allow access a user's profile information.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsersById

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> getUsersById(java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids)
        Gets a list of particular users profiles. The data returned by this call will be checked and filtered on the basis of the privacy settings of each requested user.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, the full user profile will be returned .
        Parameters:
        ids - Id's of the requested user.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get user details' resource page

      • getUserById

        public CallSpec<XingUser,HttpError> getUserById(java.lang.String id)
        Gets a particular user’s profile. The data returned by this call will be checked and filtered on the basis of the privacy settings of the requested user.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, the full user profile will be returned .
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the requested user.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get user details' resource page

      • getOwnIdCard

        public CallSpec<XingUser,HttpError> getOwnIdCard()
        Get the minimal profile information of the authorizing user.

        If more user details required consider using getOwnProfile().

        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get your id card' resource page

      • findUsersByEmail

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> findUsersByEmail(java.util.List<java.lang.String> emails)
        Gets the list of users that belong directly to the given list of email addresses. The users will be returned in the same order as the corresponding email addresses. If addresses are invalid or no user was found, the user will be returned as null.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        hash_function Hash emails values using the specified function. Currently only MD5 is supported.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return in user objects. If this parameter is not set, only the user ID will be set.
        Parameters:
        emails - List of email addresses to search for.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Find users by email address' resource page

      • findUsersByKeyword

        @Experimental
public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> findUsersByKeyword(java.lang.String keywords)
        Returns the list of users found in accordance with the given list of keywords.

        This call is EXPERIMENTAL and is not suited for a production environments as it may be missing some functionality, and both input and output interfaces are subject to change. Only certain consumers are granted access to experimental calls. When in doubt, please contact the API team.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restricts the number of profile visits to be returned. This must be a positive number. Default: 10, Maximum: 100.
        offset Offset. This must be a positive number. Default: 0.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return in nested user objects. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        Parameters:
        keywords - A String representing the keywords to search for, if this is empty the search will return and empty set
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Find users by keywords' resource page
